Description: The Encounter resource defines the setting where patient care takes place. This includes ambulatory, inpatient, emergency, home health, and virtual encounters.

accidentrelated.Name: extension
accidentrelated.Description: If true, this encounter is accident-related.

account.Name: account
account.Description: The hospital account associated with an encounter.

class.Name: class
class.Description:
Classification of patient encounter.
For organizations in the Netherlands, this element includes only the ACT encounter code, following the same logic used for Care Everywhere encounter CDA documents.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

diagnosis.Name: diagnosis
diagnosis.Description:
Reference to the Condition (Problem) resource. Returns the principal problem for the hospital encounter. Used only for hospital encounters.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

episodeOfCare.Name: episodeOfCare
episodeOfCare.Description: The episode associated with the encounter.

hospitalization.Name: hospitalization
hospitalization.Description: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

destination.Name: destination
destination.Description: Location to which the patient is discharged. Reference to a Location resource.

dischargeDisposition.Name: dischargeDisposition
dischargeDisposition.Description:
Category or kind of location after discharge. This element returns dispositions from external concept mapping for organizations in the Netherlands.
This element is available starting in the November 2021 version of Epic.

origin.Name: origin
origin.Description: The location from which the patient came before admission.

reAdmission.Name: reAdmission
reAdmission.Description: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The unique identifier(s) for the encounter.

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this encounter is scannable.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Can return a department, location, hospital room, or bed. Department and location are determined dynamically depending on a variety of factors.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Location the encounter takes place. Reference to a Location resource.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

participant.Name: participant
participant.Description: List of participants involved in the encounter.

individual.Name: individual
individual.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource representing the participant.

period.Name: period
period.Description: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated. No period is populated for admitting and referring providers.

specialty.Name: extension
specialty.Description: Specialty of the participant in the encounter.

team-name.Name: extension
team-name.Description: Team name of the participant in the encounter.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Role of participant in encounter. This element is set to ADM for admitting provider, ATND for attending provider, REF for referring provider, or OTTM for other treatment team members.

partOf.Name: partOf
partOf.Description: Another Encounter this encounter is part of. Reference to an Encounter resource.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start and end time of the encounter.

priority.Name: priority
priority.Description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: The reason for visit. The reason parameter may not always be populated. Unlike the Condition resource which documents diagnoses such as the flu, the reason parameter corresponds to the reason a patient gave for having that encounter such as a fever.

serviceType.Name: serviceType
serviceType.Description: Type of service associated with this encounter.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The encounter status. Full list of statuses can be found here.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource who was the subject of the encounter.
